Leave catheter in place without anticoagulation

Questions.Question: What is the management of catheter-associated tip thrombi?

Answers.Choices: Leave catheter in place without anticoagulation
Leave catheter in place and begin anticoagulation

Questions.Question: When should special attention be given to catheter-associated tip thrombi?

Answers.Choices: Patients with upper extremity deep venous thrombosis
Patients with left to right cardiac shunts

Questions.Question: Which is most suggestive of a central venous catheter-associated fibrin sheath?

Answers.Choices: Catheter flushes, but does not aspirate
Catheter aspirates, but does not flush
Catheter does not flush or aspirate

Questions.Question: Which is the first step in evaluation of a malfunctioning central venous catheter?

Answers.Choices: Obtain computed tomography of the chest

Patients with filters placed for venous thromboembolism prophylaxis should undergo imaging of the lower-extremity veins (duplex venous ultrasound) prior to filter retrieval

Stripping the vein is NOT a viable alternative

Is an absolute contraindication to further treatment
Requires addition of 0.05 mg/kg tissue plasminogen activator to the saline solution
Should prompt the patient be given 1 mg epinephrine every 3-5 minutes until resolution

Is most commonly related to pulmonary embolism

Questions.Question: Post-thrombotic syndrome is related to what?

Answers.Choices: Venous valvular damage and resultant reflux
Ongoing venous obstruction related to incomplete thrombus clearance

Questions.Question: Symptoms of post-thrombotic syndrome include the following EXCEPT what?

Compression of the left iliac vein by the left iliac artery
Compression of the right iliac vein by the right iliac artery
Compression of the right iliac vein by the left iliac artery
Compression of the inferior vena cava by the left iliac artery
Compression of the inferior vena cava by the right iliac artery

1 gram for every 5 liters over 5 liters

3 grams for every 5 liters over 5 liters

Questions.Question: What is the purpose of albumin after paracentesis?

To prevent elevated liver enzymes and liver failure
To lower the risk of hepatic encephalopathy
To lower the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding
To lower the risk of disseminated intravascular coagulation

Questions.Question: What is the maximum amount of fluid that should be removed during thoracentesis?

Answers.Choices: There is no maximum amount if careful attention is paid to the clinical status of the patient

Questions.Question: Fluid removal during thoracentesis is limited due to risk of what?
